text: I'm a newbie to programming and I've decided to start with Python.
Just curious though, is it enough/recommended to learn Python from online tutorials or from books?
I want to go further than simple "Hello World!
I'm not sure if books will actually teach you how to make more advanced programs.
How do you even start programming a program like this?
Do you just sit down and start writing the code, or do you have to search for APIs or anything?
I went through the code briefly and it all looked alien to me.
I'm not really sure how to express my questions into words, so do check back because I'll edit my question if the right words come to me.
